alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Custer; Kiowa; Roger Mills; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 11:40AM CDT until June 23 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in southwest Oklahoma, Kiowa. In western Oklahoma, Beckham, Custer, Roger Mills and Washita. * WHEN...Until 245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1140 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elk City, Weatherford, Clinton, Cordell, Cheyenne, Burns Flat, Sentinel, Arapaho, Hammon, Dill City, Canute, Corn, Butler, Bessie, Rocky, Foss, Colony, Strong City, Foss Reservoir and Cloud Chief. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.

area.areaDesc: Beckham; Custer; Kiowa; Roger Mills; Washita
